intro: Psoralea americana var. polystachia, commonly known as the hairy psoralea, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
